paper_title.en: The first evidence of a deeply bound state of Xi(-)-N-14 system

description.en: We have observed a deeply bound state of the Xi(-)-N-14 system that decayed into twin single-hypernuclei in nuclear emulsion exposed in the E373 experiment at KEK-PS. The process is uniquely identified as Xi(-) + N-14 -> Be-10(Lambda) + He-5(Lambda). We have measured the binding energy of the Xi(-)-N-14 system, B Xi-, to be 4.38 +/- 0.25MeV, which is significantly larger than that of the Xi(-)-N-14 3D atomic state (0.17 MeV), if both single-hypernuclei are emitted in the ground state from at-rest capture of a Xi-hyperon. If the Be-10(Lambda) nucleus is produced in an excited state, the B Xi- value mentioned above decreases by the excitation energy. Model calculations based on known values for Be-9 excited states have predicted two excited states in the bound region. Even in the case of Be-10(Lambda) production in the highest excited state, the B Xi- value is far from the 3D atomic level of the Xi(-)-N-14 system by more than 3.7 standard deviations. The event provides the first clear evidence of a deeply bound state of the Xi(-)-N-14 system by an attractive Xi N interaction.

publication_name.en: Progress of Theoretical and Experimental Physics

paper_title.en: Double-Lambda hypernuclei observed in a hybrid emulsion experiment
paper_title.ja: Double-Λ hypernuclei observed in a hybrid emulsion experiment

description.en: A hybrid experiment with nuclear emulsion and scintillating-fiber detectors (KEK-E373) has been performed to search for double-strangeness systems. Among about 10(3) events of Xi(-) hyperons captured at rest by emulsion nuclei, we have observed four events which clearly show the topology of cascade weak decays of double-Lambda hypernuclei including the "Nagara" event. Regarding the Nagara event, values of the two-Lambda binding energy (B-Lambda Lambda) and the Lambda-Lambda interaction energy (Delta B-Lambda Lambda) of He-6(Lambda Lambda) have been revised to 6.91 +/- 0.16 and 0.67 +/- 0.17 MeV, respectively, due to the recent change of the Xi(-) mass value (Particle Data Group). For another three events, we have determined possible species of double-Lambda hypernuclei together with their binding energies.
description.ja: A hybrid experiment with nuclear emulsion and scintillating-fiber detectors (KEK-E373) has been performed to search for double-strangeness systems. Among about 103 events of Ξ- hyperons captured at rest by emulsion nuclei, we have observed four events which clearly show the topology of cascade weak decays of double-Λ hypernuclei including the "Nagara" event. Regarding the Nagara event, values of the two-Λ binding energy (BΛΛ) and the Λ-Λ interaction energy (ΔBΛΛ) of ΛΛ6He have been revised to 6.91 ± 0.16 and 0.67 ± 0.17 MeV, respectively, due to the recent change of the Ξ- mass value (Particle Data Group). For another three events, we have determined possible species of double-Λ hypernuclei together with their binding energies. © 2013 American Physical Society.

description.en: Excitation spectra of electromagnetic hypernuclear production have been calculated in the DWIA framework for the typical medium-mass targets Si-28, Ca-40, and Cr-52. Available models for the elementary kaon photo-production amplitudes are carefully examined, presenting their basic properties and comparison with data. The selective excitation of unnatural parity highest-spin states (natural parity ones for the LS-closed targets) is clearly demonstrated and provides a unique opportunity to investigate series of A single-particle energies in this mass region not yet explored with sub-MeV energy resolution. (C) 2012 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
description.ja: Excitation spectra of electromagnetic hypernuclear production have been calculated in the DWIA framework for the typical medium-mass targets 28Si, 40Ca, and 52Cr. Available models for the elementary kaon photo-production amplitudes are carefully examined, presenting their basic properties and comparison with data. The selective excitation of unnatural parity highest-spin states (natural parity ones for the LS-closed targets) is clearly demonstrated and provides a unique opportunity to investigate series of Λ single-particle energies in this mass region not yet explored with sub-MeV energy resolution. © 2012 Elsevier B.V.

paper_title.en: MESON EXCHANGE MODEL WITH THE AXIAL VECTOR A(1)-MESON EXCHANGE AND HYPERNUCLEAR NONMESONIC DECAY ASYMMETRIES

description.en: The axial vector a(1)-menson exchange is introduced in the nonmesonic weak decay model. The a(1)-exchange is found to give remarkable modifications of the parity-conserving decay potentials in S-1,S-3 -> (1,3) S and S-3(1) -> D-3(1) channels at short range. Calculate asymmetry parameters alpha(Lambda) for s- and p-shell hypernuclei in the 'pi + 2 pi/rho + 2 pi/sigma + omega + K + rho pi/a(1) + sigma pi/a(1)'-exchange model are obtained to be positive and small, which are consistent with the available data.

publisher.en: WORLD SCIENTIFIC PUBL CO PTE LTD

paper_title.ja: Meson exchange model with the axial vector A1-meson exchange and hypernuclear nonmesonic decay asymmetries
paper_title.en: Meson exchange model with the axial vector A1-meson exchange and hypernuclear nonmesonic decay asymmetries

description.ja: The axial vector a1-meson exchange is introduced in the nonmesonic weak decay model. The a1 - exchange is found to give remarkable modifications of the parity-conserving decay potentials in 1,3S → 1,3S and 3S1 → 3D1 channels at short range. Calculated asymmetry parameters αΛ for s- and p-shell hypernu-clei in the 'π + 2π/ρ + 2π/σ + ω + K + ρπ/a1 + σπ/a1'-exchange model are obtained to be positive and small, which are consistent with the available data.
description.en: The axial vector a1-meson exchange is introduced in the nonmesonic weak decay model. The a1 - exchange is found to give remarkable modifications of the parity-conserving decay potentials in 1,3S → 1,3S and 3S1 → 3D1 channels at short range. Calculated asymmetry parameters αΛ for s- and p-shell hypernu-clei in the 'π + 2π/ρ + 2π/σ + ω + K + ρπ/a1 + σπ/a1'-exchange model are obtained to be positive and small, which are consistent with the available data.

publication_name.ja: Proceedings of the Sendai International Symposium: Strangeness in Nuclear and Hadronic Systems, SENDAI 2008
publication_name.en: Proceedings of the Sendai International Symposium: Strangeness in Nuclear and Hadronic Systems, SENDAI 2008

description.en: Theoretical hypernuclear photoproduction spectra are demonstrated by choosing typical medium-heavy nuclear targets such as (28)Si, (40)Ca, and (52)Cr. The predictions provide us with interesting opportunities of spectroscopic study beyond p-shell on the dynamical coupling between a hyperon and nuclear core excitations.

publisher.en: WORLD SCIENTIFIC PUBL CO PTE LTD

publication_name.en: INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF MODERN PHYSICS E-NUCLEAR PHYSICS

description.ja: The recent theoretical studies of Λ-hypernuclear weak decays of the nonmesonic and π-mesonic ones are developed with the aim to disclose the link between the experimental decay observables and the underlying basic weak decay interactions and the weak decay mechanisms. The expressions of the nonmesonic decay rates Γnm and the decay asymmetry parameter α1 of protons from the polarized hypernuclei are presented in the shell model framework. We then introduce the meson theoretical AN → NN interactions which include the one-meson exchanges, the correlated-2π exchanges, and the chiral-pair-meson exchanges. The features of meson exchange potentials and their roles on the nonmesonic decays are discussed. With the adoption of the π + 2π/ρ + 2π/σ + ω + K + ρπ/α1 + απ/α1 exchange potentials, we have carried out the systematic calculations of the nonmesonic decay observables for light-to-heavy hypernuclei. The present model can account for the available experimental data of the decay rates, Γn/ Γp ratios, and the intrinsic asymmetry parameters αΛ (α1 is related to α1 of emitted protons well and consistently within the error bars. The hypernuclear lifetimes are evaluated by converting the total weak decay rates Γtot = Γπ+Γnm to τ, which exhibit saturation property for the hypernuclear mass A ≥ 30 and agree grossly well with experimental data for the mass range from light to heavy hypernuclei except for the very light ones. Future extensions of the model and the remaining problems are also mentioned. The π-mesonic weak processes are briefly surveyed, and the calculations and predictions are compared and confirmed by the recent high precision FINUDA π-mesonic decay data. This shows that the theoretical basis seems to be firmly grounded.
description.en: The recent theoretical studies of Λ-hypernuclear weak decays of the nonmesonic and π-mesonic ones are developed with the aim to disclose the link between the experimental decay observables and the underlying basic weak decay interactions and the weak decay mechanisms. The expressions of the nonmesonic decay rates Γnm and the decay asymmetry parameter α1 of protons from the polarized hypernuclei are presented in the shell model framework. We then introduce the meson theoretical AN → NN interactions which include the one-meson exchanges, the correlated-2π exchanges, and the chiral-pair-meson exchanges. The features of meson exchange potentials and their roles on the nonmesonic decays are discussed. With the adoption of the π + 2π/ρ + 2π/σ + ω + K + ρπ/α1 + απ/α1 exchange potentials, we have carried out the systematic calculations of the nonmesonic decay observables for light-to-heavy hypernuclei. The present model can account for the available experimental data of the decay rates, Γn/ Γp ratios, and the intrinsic asymmetry parameters αΛ (α1 is related to α1 of emitted protons well and consistently within the error bars. The hypernuclear lifetimes are evaluated by converting the total weak decay rates Γtot = Γπ+Γnm to τ, which exhibit saturation property for the hypernuclear mass A ≥ 30 and agree grossly well with experimental data for the mass range from light to heavy hypernuclei except for the very light ones. Future extensions of the model and the remaining problems are also mentioned. The π-mesonic weak processes are briefly surveyed, and the calculations and predictions are compared and confirmed by the recent high precision FINUDA π-mesonic decay data. This shows that the theoretical basis seems to be firmly grounded.

paper_title.ja: (π+, K+) Reaction spectroscopy of heavy hypernuclei
paper_title.en: (π+, K+) Reaction spectroscopy of heavy hypernuclei

description.ja: For the last few decades the (π+,K+) reaction has played an important role in heavy hypernuclear spectroscopy where the A spin-orbit splitting should be one of the most interesting subjects. In this article, first, various stages of calculational frameworks for hypernuclear production cross sections are discussed. Then, focusing on the 89Y(π,+K+)89ΛY experimental data, new DWIA analysis has been carried out by taking full account of the core nuclear excitation effects. As a result we found that one of the doublet peaks comes from the nuclear core excitation and that the Λ spin-orbit splitting is small in consistent with the finding in the p-shell hypernuclei.
description.en: For the last few decades the (π+,K+) reaction has played an important role in heavy hypernuclear spectroscopy where the A spin-orbit splitting should be one of the most interesting subjects. In this article, first, various stages of calculational frameworks for hypernuclear production cross sections are discussed. Then, focusing on the 89Y(π,+K+)89ΛY experimental data, new DWIA analysis has been carried out by taking full account of the core nuclear excitation effects. As a result we found that one of the doublet peaks comes from the nuclear core excitation and that the Λ spin-orbit splitting is small in consistent with the finding in the p-shell hypernuclei.

paper_title.ja: Spectroscopy of electro- and photo-productions of hypernuclei
paper_title.en: Spectroscopy of electro- and photo-productions of hypernuclei

description.ja: Recently hypernuclear electroproduction experiments have been successfully carried out at the Thomas Jefferson Laboratory, providing high-resolution spectroscopic data. This article discusses several facets inherent to this reaction process: First, numerous theoretical attempts in describing the elementary kaon photoproduction are summarized so as to choose appropriate elementary amplitudes to be used for hypernuclear production estimates. The reaction process is characterized by both the sizable momentum transfer and the spin-flip dominace involved in the transition operator. The DWIA theoretical excitation spectra of producing p-shell hypernucli are discussed together with the experimental ones obtained recently. Encouraged with the successful theory-experiment comparison, the calculational framework has been applied beyond p-shell to typical medium-heavy hypernuclear production. The hypernuclear photo-production spectra predicted with the 19F, 28Si, and 40Catargets suggest that the unique characters of the electroproduction are more clearly appeared in the medium-mass region, providing interesting opportunities of spectroscopic study beyond p-shell.
description.en: Recently hypernuclear electroproduction experiments have been successfully carried out at the Thomas Jefferson Laboratory, providing high-resolution spectroscopic data. This article discusses several facets inherent to this reaction process: First, numerous theoretical attempts in describing the elementary kaon photoproduction are summarized so as to choose appropriate elementary amplitudes to be used for hypernuclear production estimates. The reaction process is characterized by both the sizable momentum transfer and the spin-flip dominace involved in the transition operator. The DWIA theoretical excitation spectra of producing p-shell hypernucli are discussed together with the experimental ones obtained recently. Encouraged with the successful theory-experiment comparison, the calculational framework has been applied beyond p-shell to typical medium-heavy hypernuclear production. The hypernuclear photo-production spectra predicted with the 19F, 28Si, and 40Catargets suggest that the unique characters of the electroproduction are more clearly appeared in the medium-mass region, providing interesting opportunities of spectroscopic study beyond p-shell.

Theoretical hypernuclear photoproduction spectra are demonstrated by choosing typical medium-heavy nuclear targets such as Si-28, Ca-40, and Cr-52. The predictions provide us with interesting opportunities of spectroscopic study beyond p-shell on the dynamical coupling between a hyperon and nuclear core excitations.

publisher.en: WORLD SCIENTIFIC PUBL CO PTE LTD

publication_name.en: STRANGENESS IN NUCLEAR AND HADRONIC SYSTEMS (SENDAI08)

paper_title.en: Role of the axial vector a(1)-meson exchange in hypernuclear nonmesonic weak decays

description.en: In the meson-theoretical potential model for the study of the nonmesonic decay rates and asymmetries of hypernuclei, for the first time, the axial-vector a(1) meson (J(PC)=1(++),m(a1)=1230 MeV) is introduced. The a(1) meson is the chiral partner of the rho meson and has been treated in the meson-pair exchange framework as rho pi/a(1) and sigma pi/a(1). This is analogous to the treatment of rho and sigma exchange in our model. The a(1)-meson exchange is found to give remarkable modifications of the parity-conserving decay potentials ((1,3)S ->(1,3)S and (3)S(1)->(3)D(1)) at short range r <= 1 fm. As a result, the calculated intrinsic asymmetry parameter alpha(Lambda) for (5)(Lambda)He becomes very small and positive in good agreement with the recent high-quality experimental data. The calculated small values of alpha(Lambda) are well compared with the data for (11)(Lambda)B and (12)(Lambda)C within error bars. The inclusion of the a(1) meson also improves the Gamma(n)/Gamma(p) ratios and leads to a consistent explanation for the existing nonmesonic weak decay data of the light Lambda hypernuclei (A <= 12). The results calculated in the pi+2 pi/rho+2 pi/sigma+omega+K+rho pi/a(1)+sigma pi/a(1) exchange interaction model are presented together with the estimates without a(1). Also, the derivation of the expression for the proton asymmetry is described in some detail to elucidate the calculation procedures and phase conventions.

paper_title.en: Nonmesonic weak decays of single-Lambda and double-Lambda hypernuclei of light mass systems
paper_title.ja: Nonmesonic weak decays of single-λ and double-λ hypernuclei of light mass systems

description.en: The. nucleon-induced and hyperon-induced nonmesonic weak decay rates of the single-Lambda and double-Lambda hypernuclei are evaluated in the meson-exchange potential model. The roles of K-meson exchange are discussed. The LambdaLambda --> nLambda decay rate of He-6(LambdaLambda) is estimated to be fair and might be detectable in a future experiment.
description.ja: The nucleon-induced and hyperon-induced nonmesonic weak decay rates of the single-A and double-Λ hypernuclei are evaluated in the meson-exchange potential model. The roles of K-meson exchange are discussed. The ΛΛ → nΛ decay rate of ∧∧ 6 He is estimated to be fair and might be detectable in a future experiment.

paper_title.en: Nonmesonic decays and lifetimes of hypernuclei

description.en: The nonmesonic decay rates and the lifetimes of hypernuclei of mass A= 4-209 are extensively calculated based on the 1pi, correlated-2pi, and 1omega exchange potentials. Two types of new hyperon-nucleon potentials have been constructed in which the two pions are correlated and coupled to rho and/or sigma in the exchange process. The roles of these potentials and 1omega exchange potential are discussed. The theoretical decay rates are consistent with the existing data for s-shell and p-shell hypernuclei within the present model. The calculated decay rate increases gradually up to A similar or equal to 60 and then tends to be almost constant for A greater than or similar to 60. The A-dependent behavior of the hypernuclear lifetimes tends to be constant over the mass region A > 30 of hypernuclei in our model. It is most remarkable that the cooperative effect of the correlated-2pi and 1pi exchanges enhances the neutron-stimulated decay rate Gamma(n) (proton-stimulated one Gamma(p)) by 400-450% (20-30%) with respect to the standard 1 pi-exchange estimate for A > 5. As a result the Gamma(n)/Gamma(p) ratios for light-to-heavy hypernuclei are calculated to be 0.4-0.5, which values are several times larger than the 1 pi-exchange estimate. Although the experimental ratios seem still about two times larger than these theoretical values, it has revealed that the representative 2 pi-exchange and 1omega exchange mechanisms give rise to a clear improvement on the Gamma(n)/Gamma(p) ratios.

paper_title.en: Nonmesonic decays and lifetimes of hypernuclei

description.en: The nonmesonic decay rates and the lifetimes of hypernuclei of mass A= 4-209 are extensively calculated based on the 1pi, correlated-2pi, and 1omega exchange potentials. Two types of new hyperon-nucleon potentials have been constructed in which the two pions are correlated and coupled to rho and/or sigma in the exchange process. The roles of these potentials and 1omega exchange potential are discussed. The theoretical decay rates are consistent with the existing data for s-shell and p-shell hypernuclei within the present model. The calculated decay rate increases gradually up to A similar or equal to 60 and then tends to be almost constant for A greater than or similar to 60. The A-dependent behavior of the hypernuclear lifetimes tends to be constant over the mass region A > 30 of hypernuclei in our model. It is most remarkable that the cooperative effect of the correlated-2pi and 1pi exchanges enhances the neutron-stimulated decay rate Gamma(n) (proton-stimulated one Gamma(p)) by 400-450% (20-30%) with respect to the standard 1 pi-exchange estimate for A > 5. As a result the Gamma(n)/Gamma(p) ratios for light-to-heavy hypernuclei are calculated to be 0.4-0.5, which values are several times larger than the 1 pi-exchange estimate. Although the experimental ratios seem still about two times larger than these theoretical values, it has revealed that the representative 2 pi-exchange and 1omega exchange mechanisms give rise to a clear improvement on the Gamma(n)/Gamma(p) ratios.

description.en: The nonmesonic decay rates and the lifetimes of hypernuclei of mass A= 4-209 are extensively calculated based on the 1pi, correlated-2pi, and 1omega exchange potentials. Two types of new hyperon-nucleon potentials have been constructed in which the two pions are correlated and coupled to rho and/or sigma in the exchange process. The roles of these potentials and 1omega exchange potential are discussed. As a result the Gamma(n)/Gamma(p) ratios for light-to-heavy hypernuclei are calculated to be 0.4-0.5, which values are several times larger than the 1 pi-exchange estimate. Although the experimental ratios seem still about two times larger than these theoretical values, it has revealed that the representative 2 pi-exchange and 1omega exchange mechanisms give rise to a clear improvement on the Gamma(n)/Gamma(p) ratios.

description.ja: Our weak decay studies of the single-Λ hypernuclei are briefly reviewed. By introducing the hyperon-induced weak decay potentials based on the correlated two-pion exchange and the one-pion exchange model, we estimate both the nucleon-induced and the hyperon- induced nonmesonic decay rates as well as the mesonic decay rates for light 6 ΛΛHe and 4 ΛΛH hypernuclei.
description.en: Our weak decay studies of the single-Λ hypernuclei are briefly reviewed. By introducing the hyperon-induced weak decay potentials based on the correlated two-pion exchange and the one-pion exchange model, we estimate both the nucleon-induced and the hyperon- induced nonmesonic decay rates as well as the mesonic decay rates for light 6 ΛΛHe and 4 ΛΛH hypernuclei.
